action_space.name: Establish Rapport
action_space.goal: Build trust and safety between therapist and client to create a supportive environment.
action_space.description: Focus on forming a strong therapeutic alliance by demonstrating empathy, warmth, and acceptance.

micro_actions.name: Warm Greeting
micro_actions.description: Begin the session with a welcoming tone and express appreciation for the client’s presence.

micro_actions.name: Active Listening
micro_actions.description: Listen attentively without interruption, using verbal and nonverbal cues to show engagement.

micro_actions.name: Empathic Reflection
micro_actions.description: Paraphrase and reflect back the client’s feelings to validate their emotional experience.

action_space.name: Clarify Concerns
action_space.goal: Help the client clearly articulate and prioritize the issues they want to address.
action_space.description: Guide the client in exploring their main concerns and defining specific areas for intervention.

micro_actions.name: Open-Ended Questioning
micro_actions.description: Ask broad, non-leading questions to invite the client to share more about their concerns.

micro_actions.name: Summarize Key Issues
micro_actions.description: Provide a concise summary of the client’s concerns to confirm understanding.

micro_actions.name: Set Agenda
micro_actions.description: Collaboratively decide which topics will be the focus of the session.

action_space.name: Psychoeducation
action_space.goal: Increase the client’s understanding of their difficulties and provide relevant knowledge.
action_space.description: Explain psychological concepts or coping mechanisms to enhance the client’s insight and self-management.

micro_actions.name: Explain Concept
micro_actions.description: Present a psychological concept (e.g., cognitive distortions) in simple, relatable language.

micro_actions.name: Provide Examples
micro_actions.description: Offer real-life or hypothetical examples to illustrate how the concept applies to the client.

micro_actions.name: Check Understanding
micro_actions.description: Ask the client to explain the concept back or provide feedback to ensure clarity.

action_space.name: Cognitive Restructuring
action_space.goal: Help the client identify and modify unhelpful thoughts and beliefs.
action_space.description: Collaboratively work with the client to challenge distorted thinking and develop healthier perspectives.

micro_actions.name: Identify Negative Thought
micro_actions.description: Ask the client to share a recent distressing thought or belief.

micro_actions.name: Examine Evidence
micro_actions.description: Guide the client to evaluate evidence supporting and contradicting the thought.

micro_actions.name: Generate Alternative Thought
micro_actions.description: Collaboratively create a more balanced or adaptive interpretation.

action_space.name: Behavioral Activation
action_space.goal: Increase engagement in positive activities to improve mood and functioning.
action_space.description: Encourage the client to plan and carry out rewarding or meaningful activities.

micro_actions.name: Activity Scheduling
micro_actions.description: Work with the client to schedule specific enjoyable or productive activities.

micro_actions.name: Reinforce Progress
micro_actions.description: Provide positive feedback for attempts to engage in planned activities.

micro_actions.name: Problem-Solve Barriers
micro_actions.description: Collaboratively identify and address obstacles to activity completion.

action_space.name: Skill Building
action_space.goal: Equip the client with new coping and interpersonal skills to manage challenges.
action_space.description: Teach and rehearse practical skills that support emotional regulation, communication, and problem-solving.

micro_actions.name: Teach Skill Step-by-Step
micro_actions.description: Break down the new skill into small, clear steps and explain each one.

micro_actions.name: Model Skill
micro_actions.description: Demonstrate the skill in action to provide a concrete example.

micro_actions.name: Role Play Practice
micro_actions.description: Engage the client in a simulated scenario to practice using the skill.

action_space.name: Review and Consolidate Progress
action_space.goal: Reinforce therapeutic gains and prepare for maintenance outside of sessions.
action_space.description: Summarize progress, highlight strengths, and develop a plan for continued improvement.

micro_actions.name: Summarize Achievements
micro_actions.description: Review key progress made during the session or across sessions.

micro_actions.name: Highlight Strengths
micro_actions.description: Identify and affirm the client’s personal resources and successes.

micro_actions.name: Plan Next Steps
micro_actions.description: Collaboratively set goals or actions for the client to work on before the next session.

Conversation_states.Description: Degree of the client’s active participation and attention; helps guide pacing and choice of interventions.
Intensity of the client’s emotional state (anxiety, anger, sadness); crucial for deciding when to regulate or deepen exploration.
Extent to which distorted thinking patterns are currently active; indicates opportunities for cognitive restructuring.
How much the client is gaining new understanding about thoughts, feelings, and behaviors; guides therapist to consolidate or deepen insight.
Strength of rapport, trust, and collaboration between therapist and client; vital for effective interventions.
Shared clarity on therapy goals or session objectives; helps decide whether to revisit agenda or move forward.
Conversation_states.Values: 0 (no clear goals) → 1 (highly clear and agreed goals)

Conversation_states.Description: Client’s readiness and commitment to act on coping strategies or homework; indicates when to assign tasks.
Client’s capacity to stay with difficult emotions without avoidance; informs pacing of exposure or challenging thoughts.
Degree to which the conversation stays aligned with agreed agenda vs. drifting to unrelated topics.
How well the client is learning and practicing CBT skills during the session.
Client’s sense of optimism and perceived efficacy of therapy; influences motivation and alliance.
Ability of the client to regulate emotions during the session; important for selecting interventions.

knowledge_graph.description: The central node representing the individual receiving therapy.
Basic patient information such as age, gender, occupation, cultural background.
A single therapy encounter, including date, duration, and notes.
The main issue or concern that brought the patient to therapy.
Specific emotional, cognitive, or physical symptoms experienced by the patient.
Formal clinical diagnosis or provisional assessment.
Therapeutic goals collaboratively defined between patient and therapist.
Tracking of the patient’s improvement or setbacks across sessions.
Specific techniques or strategies applied during therapy (e.g., cognitive restructuring, exposure, relaxation training).
Practical strategies learned and practiced to handle distress or difficult situations.
Significant external events in the patient’s life (e.g., job change, relationship issues, trauma).
Prescribed medications and their effects on symptoms or functioning.
Relationships and social supports available to the patient (family, friends, peers).
Quality of the relationship and trust between therapist and patient.
